p: Based on the lentiviral sequences available in 2003, Bailes et al [ 12] suggested that the SIV cpz genome is a recombinant of just two parental lineages. SIV rcm (which infects red-capped mangabeys) was identified as the 5’ donor, and an SIV from the SIV mon/-mus/-gsn clade (which infect primates in the Cercopithecus genus) was identified as the 3’ donor. Since the time of this previous investigation many new lentiviruses have been discovered and sequenced. In incorporating these new data, we find clear evidence that the previous two-donor hypothesis may be incomplete.
